reviewText:
I have a ton of bellydance DVDs and this one goes way down to the bottom of the pile. The content starts with a flimsy-looking warmup, then on to hip moves which was not too bad. She doesn't tell you what the movements are for the most part however she did blend some of the hip moves with some traveling which does help coordination. Unfortunately, there is nothing else positive to report on this DVD . If you never had any other bellydance dvd, you wouldn't know any way to compare it but believe me, I do.... and it is just isn't that good. The music soundtrack is terrible...sounds like a cross between old theatrical Hollywood bellydance music and a haunted house soundtrack...pretty awful. If you are a housewife and want a few moves to please your man, this DVD will be okay but if you want to be in bellydance troupe someday or just be able to perform in a Hafla, forget it... You would need a better video. My most recent favorite for beginners is Heather Waymans Bellydance for busy women. She teaches in a clear manner and has a buildible menu of options on her DVD.
This video, 'learn belly dancing' in contrast ,has instruction that isn't clear and in my opinion, she wasn't that good a dancer. She covered hip movements ok, but everything else she went over was seriously insufficient ....arm movements, chest movements, belly roll, shimmy work (atrocious instruction on this ), veil, zils, and choosing a costume. The production value is old as well however that doesn't always mean the video will be bad. Also, the picture of the woman on the cover is not the one who instructs in the video. Not good....

I can't decide if this video is just plain bad or truly horrible.  As a belly dance instructor I am always looking for new ways to instruct my students on basic belly dance moves.  I found this video only rushes thru the moves and does not give adequate instructions on how to achieve the moves.  Not only that, she only does movements on one side for various moves so you do not even get a good workout.  I thinking about trading this one in; for me it has very little redeeming value both literally and figuratively.
I found this a very good workout,  it is very basic breakdown of moves is which I was looking.
